blurb: Red is a next-generation full stack programming language, strongly inspired by REBOL.

concepts.name: Types
concepts.blurb: Each value has a type. Red allows you to choose from more than 50 types.

concepts.name: Blocks
concepts.blurb: Blocks are groups of words and variables.

concepts.name: Evaluation
concepts.blurb: Evaluation makes a values from some code.

concepts.name: Debugging
concepts.blurb: Debugging is a process of finding errors in code.

concepts.name: Strings and other series.
concepts.blurb: Strings are values of type string!. Strings usually represent text.

concepts.name: Functions
concepts.blurb: Functions usually do something useful. And they usually return a value.

concepts.name: Contexts
concepts.blurb: Context is a set of words and their values.

concepts.name: View
concepts.blurb: View is Red's module used for programming grapfical user interface.

concepts.name: VID
concepts.blurb: VID is a dialect useful for easily defining GUI objects and layouts.
